This predicate 'has_example_instance' is the inverse of the more common 'is_instance_of' used elsewhere (e.g., example → category). If the global schema prefers a single direction for class membership, this edge may later be inverted to maintain consistency.

args.remark: This predicate 'has_example_instance' is the inverse of the more common 'is_instance_of' used elsewhere (e.g., example → category). If the global schema prefers a single direction for class membership, this edge may later be inverted to maintain consistency.
args.justification: The other relations in this chunk use 'is_instance_of' (instance → class), while this one uses the inverse direction (class → instance). Adding a remark highlights this design choice for future schema normalization without changing any fields now.
